conversation.text: Hi. I'm Rob. Would you like to make a Mock Tuna Salad?
Sure! What's the first step?
The sunflower seeds and almonds need to be soaked overnight to soften. Do you have this done already?
evidence: Soak the sunflower seeds and almonds overnight

conversation.text: Not yet. Are sunflower seeds necessary?
Yes, they add a bit more flavour and are needed to help get a good consistency. If you have not soaked them already, do you wish to just run through this recipe anyway for a later date?
Yeah, let's just go through the recipe today.
Good. Using a sieve or colander we need to drain the water from the seeds and almonds.
evidence: Drain and chop the sunflower seeds and almonds

conversation.text: No problem.
Now we will use a food processor to chop them to a fairly fine consistency. You may need to use the pulse function to do this. Can your processor do pulse?
I don't have a processor. Can I chop with knife?
Yes but the consistency will be a bit coarser. If you have a potato masher you can squash some of the chopped seeds and almonds to get a better consistency. Be careful using a knife though.
Thanks! What's next after chopping?
It is time to mix all the ingredients in a large bowl. Put the nut/seed mix in first then the other ingredients and mix together with a fork. Do you have all the other ingredients?
What are the other ingredients?
They are listed in step 3 of the recipe or you can click the "More Information" link at the top of the page for a printable listing.
evidence: Stir the ingredients together to completely combine the mixture

conversation.text: Sorry, I can see neither of them. Are "the other ingredients" stuff you didn't mention in the chat?
Yes they are chopped celery, pickles, red onion, fresh dill, maple syrup, lemon juice, kelp granules, salt and pepper. Can you not view the recipe listing?
I don't have any information about the recipe other than a title.
That is strange. I can list the ingredients in detail her if you want?
Yes, that'll be good. Thanks!

You'll need: 1/3 cup (75 g) finely chopped celery 1/3 cup (47 g) finely chopped pickles 1/4 cup (40 g) finely chopped red onion 2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill 2 tablespoons maple syrup or agave nectar 2 tablespoons lemon juice 1 teaspoon kelp granules 1 teaspoon ground black pepper 1/2 teaspoon sea salt. Phew!
evidence: Stir the ingredients together to completely combine the mixture.

conversation.text: Thanks for your list! Let's move on. What now after I have mixed all the ingredients into the bowl?
Now it is time to eat. You can use the salad as a dip with vegetable sticks or crackers, have it in a sandwich or use it as a side serving on a meal.
Cool! I don't have any questions now.
I hope you enjoy your salad. Have great day. Goodbye.

recipe.title: How to Make Vegan Mock Tuna Salad

procedure.summary: Soak the sunflower seeds and almonds overnight.
procedure.description: Measure 1 cup (140 g) of sunflower seeds and 1 cup (140 g) of raw almonds into a large bowl. Pour enough water to cover the seeds and nuts by 2 inches (5 cm). Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a kitchen towel and let it sit out at room temperature overnight. At a minimum, try to soak the seeds and nuts for at least 8 to 10 hours.

procedure.summary: Drain and chop the sunflower seeds and almonds.
procedure.description: Set a fine mesh strainer in the sink and pour the soaked seeds and nuts through it. You don't need to save the soaking liquid. Transfer the seeds and nuts to a small food processor. Put the lid on and pulse them until they're finely ground. You may need to stop and scrape down the sides of the food processor.

Put the ground seeds and nuts into a large bowl along with the rest of the salad ingredients. Stir the ingredients together to completely combine the mixture. You'll need:
1/3 cup (75 g) finely chopped celery
1/3 cup (47 g) finely chopped pickles
1/4 cup (40 g) finely chopped red onion
2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill
2 tablespoons maple syrup or agave nectar
2 tablespoons lemon juice
1 teaspoon kelp granules
1 teaspoon ground black pepper
1/2 teaspoon sea salt

Set the mock tuna salad out as a dip for crackers or vegetable sticks. You could also use it as a sandwich filling or topping for a fresh green salad. If you'd like to make the salad ahead of time and store it, cover the bowl and refrigerate it until you're ready to use it. You can store the mock tuna salad for up to 5 days in the refrigerator. Keep in mind that it may lose a little crunch the longer it chills.
